discoveredAssets: localhost:3000 - Next.js Web Application (ManaPool) - Port 3000, serving NFT/Art Investment Platform
http://localhost:3000/ - Home Page - Public landing page with marketing content and team images
http://localhost:3000/team - Team Page - Displays 5 team members with roles and profile images
http://localhost:3000/api/auth - Authentication API endpoint (POST) - Returns 400 Bad Request on invalid input
http://localhost:3000/api/s3/* - Image Serving API endpoint - Serves team photos and gallery images via /api/s3/{filename}
Next.js Development Environment - Running in development mode with source maps enabled, debug capabilities available

targets.objective: Test authentication endpoint for: NoSQL/SQL injection in POST parameters, authentication bypass attempts, input validation vulnerabilities, and API parameter fuzzing. Document the exact POST parameters expected and test for common authentication weaknesses.
targets.rationale: CRITICAL - This is a live authentication API endpoint that accepts POST requests and validates input. It represents the primary authentication attack surface. Testing for injection vulnerabilities, credential bypass, and business logic flaws is essential.

targets.objective: Test S3 image serving endpoint for: path traversal attacks to access non-image files, directory traversal vulnerabilities, arbitrary file read via filename parameter manipulation, XXE via image processing, and potential AWS credential exposure.
targets.rationale: HIGH - API endpoint serving files through a custom route. Currently returns 500 errors indicating potential misconfiguration. Testing for file access bypasses, traversal, and misconfigured AWS integration is critical for NFT/media-heavy platform.

targets.objective: Test main Next.js application for: XSS vulnerabilities in rendered content, CSRF on state changes, client-side vulnerabilities in JavaScript bundles, Next.js-specific security issues, development mode information disclosure, and frontend API discovery from JavaScript code.
targets.rationale: HIGH - Main web application entry point. Running in development mode with source maps accessible. Must verify for typical web vulnerabilities and Next.js-specific security issues. JavaScript bundles may reveal additional hidden endpoints.

targets.objective: Test team page for: XSS in dynamically rendered team member content, IDOR if team member profiles can be accessed via IDs, parameter tampering in image URLs, and information disclosure from team member data.
targets.rationale: MEDIUM - Page displays team member information and images. May have parameterized access if profiles use IDs. Good test case for IDOR and information disclosure vulnerabilities in user-facing pages.

targets.objective: Analyze all JavaScript bundles and inline scripts to discover: additional hidden API endpoints, AJAX requests to unmapped routes, data attributes containing URLs or API paths, client-side authentication logic, session management, and frontend business logic vulnerabilities.
targets.rationale: CRITICAL - Next.js applications often define endpoints in JavaScript rather than HTML. Complete analysis of /api/auth parameters, request structure, and additional API routes must be extracted from JavaScript code to ensure complete endpoint discovery.

keyFindings: [CRITICAL] /api/auth endpoint discovered - accepts POST requests, rejects with 400 Bad Request on invalid input. No authentication required. Real target for authentication vulnerability testing.
[CRITICAL] Application running in Next.js development mode - X-Powered-By header reveals framework, source maps accessible, development features enabled increasing attack surface.

[HIGH] /api/s3 endpoint returns 500 Internal Server Error - indicates backend misconfiguration, potential AWS credential issues, or improper error handling. May expose sensitive information in error responses.
[HIGH] No API documentation found (swagger.json, openapi.json return 404) - suggests undocumented API endpoints. JavaScript analysis critical to discover complete API surface.
[MEDIUM] Next.js development bundles accessible at /_next/static/ - source maps and debug information available. Could enable reverse engineering of application logic.
[MEDIUM] Team member information publicly displayed with profile images - potential information disclosure about organizational structure and personnel.
[LOW] robots.txt and sitemap.xml return 404 - application does not use standard SEO discovery mechanisms, may hide endpoints from crawlers.
